match.title: 2nd ODI
match.statusText: West Indies won by 7 wickets (with 27 balls remaining) (D/L method)

series.name: Sri Lanka tour of West Indies
series.longName: Sri Lanka tour of West Indies

ground.name: Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad
ground.longName: Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad

image.caption: Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad
image.longCaption: West Indies v South Africa, 2nd Test, Queen's Park Oval, Port of Spain, Trinidad, 17-21 March 2001

match.hoursInfo: 09.30 start, First Session 09.30-13.00 Interval 13.00-13.45, Second Session 13.45-17.15

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Taylor b Bravo 40 (82b 5x4 0x6) SR: 48.78

dismissalComment.html: Short, wide, slashed to wide third man. Tharanga's laborious effort comes to an end. He sliced it to left of Taylor who held on to it. Bravo punches his fist in delight.

headshotImage.caption: Ramnaresh Sarwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ramnaresh Sarwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Sarwan b Gayle 28 (51b 2x4 0x6) SR: 54.9

dismissalComment.html: soft dismissal! Gayle bowls a loopy full toss from around the stumps, sliding down leg stump, but Sangakkara can only sweep it to square leg
soft dismissal! Gayle bowls a loopy full toss from around the stumps, sliding down leg stump, but Sangakkara can only sweep it to square leg

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: one more wicket even as rain drops fall. Really full delivery, he went forward, the left leg went across and he ended up yorking himself. He tried to jab it away but the ball squeezed through just before the bat could come down. It is raining wickets here at Port-of-Spain.

Done in by the slower one. He rolled his fingers around the ball and Udawatte was early into his lofted square drive and it went high, really high, in air towards backward point where Chattergoon stationed himself. It swerved in the air as it dropped down, Chattergoon ran towards his right, stopped, went left, moved right and some how, managed to hang on to the delivery, lunging to his left at the last minute.

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Udawatte c Chattergoon b Taylor 14 (20b 3x4 0x6) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Done in by the slower one. He rolled his fingers around the ball and Udawatte was early into his lofted square drive and it went high, really high, in air towards backward point where Chattergoon stationed himself. It swerved in the air as it dropped down, Chattergoon ran towards his right, stopped, went left, moved right and some how, managed to hang on to the delivery, lunging to his left at the last minute.

dismissalText.commentary: Kaushalya Weeraratne c Bravo b Sammy 15 (20b 0x4 0x6) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: The fourth wicket is down. Full in  length, width outside off stump and he square drove uppishly but straight to backward point. Weeraratne is gone and Sri Lanka slid further.

headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva b Gayle 2 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: one more wicket even as rain drops fall. Really full delivery, he went forward, the left leg went across and he ended up yorking himself. He tried to jab it away but the ball squeezed through just before the bat could come down. It is raining wickets here at Port-of-Spain.

dismissalText.commentary: Marlon Samuels not out 54 (49b 3x4 3x6) SR: 110.2

headshotImage.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shivnarine Chanderpaul not out 52 (42b 3x4 2x6) SR: 123.8

headshotImage.caption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dwayne Bravo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: The first wicket is down. The off stump has been pushed back. It landed on a length, outside the off stump and cut back in sharply and Bravo, who has been bringing his bat down in an angle, leaving a big gap, pushed at it well outside the line and is cleaned up.
Gayle is gone and West Indies in a bit of bother here. 15 for 2. Gayle backed away a touch and tried to heave a full delivery on the stumps over the on-side field but hit it head-high to mid-on.

headshotImage.caption: Ramnaresh Sarwan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ramnaresh Sarwan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Two in this over. Trapped in front. It cut in from outside the off stump, from a length, Sarwan was on the walk, his front feet had not even landed on the ground when he was struck in front. Too late to get forward and he has been caught in front.

dismissalComment.html: The first wicket is down. The off stump has been pushed back. It landed on a length, outside the off stump and cut back in sharply and Bravo, who has been bringing his bat down in an angle, leaving a big gap, pushed at it well outside the line and is cleaned up.

dismissalComment.html: Two in this over. Trapped in front. It cut in from outside the off stump, from a length, Sarwan was on the walk, his front feet had not even landed on the ground when he was struck in front. Too late to get forward and he has been caught in front.

headshotImage.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

batsmen.shot: on side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Chanders gets the winning runs with a tap to the square leg region. They have won the series. The players in the dressing room erupt in joy. Mahela shakes hands with Chanderpaul. Game over.

commentPostTextItems.html: Chris Gayle comes out and envelops his batsmen with a big bear hug. He then greets the Sri Lankans with a handshake. And  the West Indian players go now for a celebratory walk around the ground. Just like they did after the Test match here.

Mahela: You can't predict the weather. We batted thinking we will be playing 50 overs. We tried our best to see if we can get West Indies all out but the middle order played well. We couldn't penetrate that lower middle order. On Chanders: We bowled at him well in the Test matches but he has come back strongly.
We will try to leave West Indies with a win in the next game.

Gayle I was a bit scared after losing three wickets but Chanderpaul and Samuels, came into the party today. Credit must be given to everyone in the squad, management. Everyone who didn't get a chance will get to play in the next game. Even the coach might get to play!
Man of the Match: Shiv it is. Chanderpaul is the man. "Let me thank God Shiva. Without his blessings, this wouldn't be possible. My family is here.
...I know Marlon was struggling, I tried to help him out there, coaxing along and get a start. Once he got that, it would be a different game for us. I put everything to God's work.
And with that, this is good bye from me, Sriram Veera, and my scorer, Srinivas Raju. See you in the next game. Good night and good luck.

commentTextItems.html: outside the off stump, stays back to force it to right of covers

another one really full, samuels gets his fifty with a drive to left of mid-on and he celebrates in fury. He punches the air, almost in anger, raises his bat to the pavilion and then punches the bat forcefully in the air. Chanders rushes across to hug him. This is about proving a point. This knock obviously means a lot to him

headshotImage.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: It's getting darker out there but Windies just need seven more.

commentTextItems.html: another one almost at the blockhole, defended to the off side
yorker length, just outside off, stabbed to point
short in length, around the off stump and Chanderpaul brings his fifty up with a cut to right of covers
low full toss, driven to left of deep cover.
Full in length, outside the off stump and Chanders clears mid-off but he had sliced it a bit and hence, it didn't go the full distance

headshotImage.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: That one has been deposited to the upper tire at the long-off stands. It was the loopy googly and Samuels rushed down the track and swung it over the boundary. Super hit that.
on the leg and middle,  squeezed to square leg
a tad quicker, just outside off stump, pushed to covers
lovely loopy delivery, Chanders comes down the track and it dips rapidly on him and he pushes it past the bowler

commentPreTextItems.html: Mark kidger: "After the Windies lost the 1st Test you wouldn't have given tuppence for their chances over the next four matches, but it looks like they will take the winning streak to three."

commentTextItems.html: charges down the track and heaves a full delivery one bounce to long-off
stays back to punch to wide long-off, they think about the second run but decide against it

headshotImage.caption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shivnarine Chanderpaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: a touch short of length, outside off, cut past backward point

Clean hit. Lovely swing of the bat. He took out the front leg from the line and hit through the line of a length delivery over long-on. Samuels didn't bother to run and stood and watched the white ball sail over the ropes.
slower one, full and on the middle, mistimes a on drive to left of midwicket. It is pretty dark out there. 30 from 45 balls.

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Power Play 2: Overs 10.1 - 15.0
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 13.6 overs (85 balls), Extras 9
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 58/1 in 16.0 overs (WU Tharanga 24, KC Sangakkara 11)

stories.title: Dyson hails West Indies win
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Port-of-Spain
stories.summary: John Dyson, the West Indies coach, has heaped praise on his side following their seven-wicket win over Sri Lanka in Trinidad

stories.title: Chanderpaul and Samuels seal series for West Indies
stories.subTitle: West Indies v Sri Lanka, 2nd ODI, Port-of-Spain
stories.summary: Shivnarine Chanderpaul came to West Indies' rescue for the second time in three days, cracking an unbeaten 52 to guide his side to a seven-wicket win in Trindad and, in doing so, they take the series
